Royal Scottish Academy

Art Galleries are very much the late adopters when it comes to new technologies - but the Royal Scottish Academy insisted that trend be broken when it came to their new website. Working in a multi disciplinary team, I was responsible for making their new digital present really pop when it came to their new site.

Homepage

Accessible Dropdowns

This large site necessitated an overhaul of how the client presented its large library of content. A new, accessible dropdown menu was designed and developed - not only just to the benefit of the Royal Scottish Academy, but also to be rolled out for all future clients.

1

1.

Accessible Dropdowns

This large site necessitated an overhaul of how the client presented its large library of content. A new, accessible dropdown menu was designed and developed - not only just to the benefit of the Royal Scottish Academy, but also to be rolled out for all future clients.

Large Imagery

With such a large inventory of available works, having big images best showcases the variety on offer - a key design objective of this project.

2

2.

Dynamically loading in additional content via AJAX requests prevents information overload, aiding a seamless user journey through the page

Transparent Header

A transparent header focuses the eye onto the exceptional imagery made available by this client

Transparent Header

Bold Typography

As a historic organisation, the RSA wanted a bold, new fresh typographic language throughout the site - with this ultra bold serif display font paired with a simple, legible body.

2

2.

Bold Typography

As a historic organisation, the RSA wanted a bold, new fresh typographic language throughout the site - with this ultra bold serif display font paired with a simple, legible body.

Subnavigation

These 'scroll to' links promote effective page navigation and act as an easy to use 'gateway' to explore the rest of the page
